title: 109_s2615
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk as follows:

"SECTION 1. FINDINGS." Congress finds that the Cape Fox Corporation is a Village Corporation for the Native Village of Saxman, Alaska, organized under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. Cape Fox, like other Village Corporations in southeast Alaska, had limitations on land selection. Cape Fox Corporation, a Village Corporation for the Native Village of Saxman, Alaska, faced restrictions on land selection within 6 miles of Ketchikan, Alaska. This limited their ability to choose valuable timber land and commercial property, leaving only remote, mountainous areas available for selection. Cape Fox Corporation, a Village Corporation for the Native Village of Saxman, Alaska, faced restrictions on land selection within 6 miles of Ketchikan, Alaska. This limited their ability to choose valuable timber land and commercial property, leaving only remote, mountainous areas available for selection as required by the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. The Annette Island Indian Reservation within the selection area further restricted Cape Fox's land selections, making them the only Village Corporation affected by these limitations. The Secretary of the Interior has informed Congress about this predicament. The Secretary has informed Congress about Cape Fox Corporation's unique predicament, which led to restrictions on their land selections under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. The adjustments made for Cape Fox and the Regional Corporation for Sealaska are in accordance with the purposes of the Act and the public interest. SEC. 2. WAIVER OF CORE TOWNSHIP REQUIREMENT FOR CERTAIN LAND. Cape Fox exempt from selecting 160 acres of Federal land. SEC. 3. SELECTION OUTSIDE EXTERIOR SELECTION BOUNDARY. Cape Fox may select and receive conveyance of approximately 99 acres of Tongass National Forest land outside its boundary within 90 days of the Act's enactment. The specific land parcels are described in detail. The Secretary will convey the subsurface estate to Sealaska Corporation upon Cape Fox receiving the surface estate of specified land parcels. The conveyances to Cape Fox and Sealaska Corporation will be completed promptly after Cape Fox's selection. The approved conveyance refers to the conveyance of specific acres of land selected and approved for conveyance. The Bureau of Land Management approved the conveyance of land to Cape Fox and Sealaska Corporation, fulfilling their entitlements under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. Cape Fox will receive the surface estate, while Sealaska Corporation will receive the subsurface estate of specified land parcels. The conveyances will be completed promptly after Cape Fox's selection.
